alert.note: Alert for Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol; Southern Worcester; Western Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 12:48PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Developing Thunderstorms Producing Heavy Rain and Minor Flooding Across Eastern Connecticut, Northern Rhode Island and Adjacent Areas of Massachusetts... At 1244 PM EDT, Doppler radar showed a line of rapidly developing showers and thunderstorms from near Glastonbury stretching east to around Providence. These storms were moving slowly to the northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy Rainfall and Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Providence, Hartford, Fall River, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, Manchester, Taunton, East Hartford, East Providence, Woonsocket, Glastonbury, Cumberland, North Providence, Franklin, West Warwick, Vernon, Windsor, Johnston, and North Attleborough. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.

area.areaDesc: Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol; Southern Worcester; Western Norfolk
